intro: Musschia aurea, commonly known as the golden moss, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Marchantiaceae. It is characterized by its dense, bright green to golden-yellow foliage, which gives it its common name. This plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. It has a thalloid structure composed of a flat, leafy stem with rhizoids for anchoring. Musschia aurea plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for small invertebrates in its native ecosystems.
